intro: Lactuca edelbergii, commonly known as the Edelberg's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lactuca edelbergii is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its edible leaves, though it is less commonly consumed than other lettuce varieties.
